definition: mortise (slot cut into wood to receive a tenon)/4th earthly branch: 5-7 a.m., 2nd solar month (6th March-4th April), year of the Rabbit/ancient Chinese compass point: 90° (east)/variant of 鉚|铆[mao3]/to exert one's strength
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
tenon (wooden projection to fit into a mortise)
mortise (slot cut into wood to receive a tenon)
mortise and tenon (slot and tab forming a carpenter's joint)
to form a seam/to join up
to fit tightly (idiom)/to join seamlessly/to fit snugly
to fasten with rivets/(coll.) to exert one's strength
bolt (male component of nut and bolt)/screw
